qas.question: Hokkien is sometimes written in what script?
What is the name of the traditional Chinese alphabet?
What is another name for POJ?
POJ alphabet has been used since late in what century?
What is the traditional Latin alphabet called?
Who first developed a mixed script of Han characters?
What is another name for Latin script?
How long has the mixed script been actively used?
What is written in the simplified Chinese script using one of several alphabets?

context: <b9_0>Hokkien<b9_0/>, especially Taiwanese, is sometimes written in the <a0_0>Latin<a0_0/> script using one of several alphabets. Of these the most popular is <a1_0><a2_0><b5_0>Pe̍h-ōe-jī<b5_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/> (traditional Chinese: 白話字; simplified Chinese: 白话字; pinyin: Báihuàzì). <b7_0>POJ<b7_0/> was developed first by <a3_0><b6_0>Presbyterian missionaries in China<b6_0/><a3_0/> and later by the indigenous Presbyterian Church in Taiwan; use of this alphabet has been actively promoted <b8_0>since the late <a4_0>19th<a4_0/> century<b8_0/>. The use of a mixed script of Han characters and Latin letters is also seen, though remains uncommon. Other Latin-based alphabets also exist.
